medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsening oxygen saturation and respiratory distress in a child post-Fontan procedure for hypoplastic left heart syndrome.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Oxygen saturation worsened below 60% on the day following surgery, with dyspnea and dry cough beginning on postoperative day 2. Intermittent complete atrioventricular block occurred starting on postoperative day 5. Respiratory distress and abdominal discomfort were reported by postoperative day 8, with new pulmonary consolidations evident by postoperative day 10. Symptoms worsened again on postoperative day 11 with respiratory distress, leading to a positive COVID-19 diagnosis on postoperative day 13.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypoplastic left heart syndrome; prior Fontan procedure.
medical_history.family_history: Both parents reported flu-like symptoms starting a week before surgery, and the child's mother experienced anosmia.
